Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.oath

Interface DcvOathDevice

  • public interface DcvOathDevice
    An DCV OATH device complying with the Standard Gemalto DCV options.
    Since:
    4.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      SecureString getDcv​(AuthInput authInput)
      Gets a time based DCV value as defined by the Standard Gemalto DCV options.
      int getLastDcvLifespan()
      Return lifespan of the last DCV computed by this device.

    • Method Detail

      • getDcv

        SecureString getDcv​(AuthInput authInput)
             throws IdpException
        Gets a time based DCV value as defined by the Standard Gemalto DCV options.
        Parameters:
        authInput - the AuthInput
        Returns:
        the DCV
        Throws:
        IdpRuntimeException - when there is a cryptography operation failure.
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
        Since:
        4.1

      • getLastDcvLifespan

        int getLastDcvLifespan()
        Return lifespan of the last DCV computed by this device.

        The following example illustrates the usage: 

           // Create DCV OATH settings (see OathFactory)
   SoftDcvOathSettings dcvOathSettings = ...

   // Create a DCV OATH device (see OathFactory)
   OathDcvDevice device = ...

   // Compute a time-based DCV with device
   device.getDcv(pin);

   // Each time getLastDcvLifespan is called, it returns the
   // remaining lifespan in seconds of the last time-based DCV. Lifespan is
   // computed with respect of device's settings (in this example it returns
   // the lifespan according to Gemalto device fixed settings, i.e. 30-seconds timestep).
   int lifespan = device.getLastDcvLifespan();
        Returns:
        • In case last DCV computed with this device is time-based
          • If positive, the last DCV is still valid according to the current time and device's timestep settings. The returned value indicates the remaining seconds before the DCV becomes obsolete.
          • If negative, the last DCV computed is obsolete. The absolute value indicates the time elapsed since the DCV has become obsolete.
        • In case last DCV computed with this device is event-based, or no DCV has been computed yet, the function returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Since:
        4.1
